string.text: There's a spot in Zaton where heat anomalies emerged underwater. They call it 'Boiler' because there's steam and stuff coming out from the ground. If you think steam is nothing, think again. Seasoned Stalkers say this kind of vapor anomaly hits you at least as hard as a regular heat anomaly, if not harder. The temperature may be a bit lower, but it grills you longer. As for artifacts, they found regular ones, the fire kind.

They say there's a nice spot in the quarry, with lots of artifacts, though not scant on anomalies either. Down at the bottom there's so many bubbles from gas anomalies, it hurts the eyes, even with a gas mask on.
Ash Heap is at the old graveyard near Kopachy. There's lots of heat anomalies and some zombies from time to time. People try to avoid the place, but they do find artifacts there.

They say artifacts have been found in the parking lot. Still got vehicles from the first Chernobyl disaster - those babies give the rad counter heartburn. In addition, the lot is full of electrical anomalies as well.

In the Putrid Grove, where trees are all warped from acid. People who've been there say it's full of gas anomalies. There's so much gas in the air that you can't see straight but with enough experience you can find the artifacts you're looking for.

If you're after artifacts, go for the acid kind. The best place to get those is the Concrete Bath. You won't have a lot of competition: no one likes that place because of its proximity to the Jupiter building.

Not far from the Jupiter plant a piece of the road fell through. They called this place Bitumen, because that's where the pavement melted. There're many anomalies in the gap - heat anomalies mixed with gravitational ones. And since it's two kinds of anomalies, the artifacts must be different, too.

There's a small harbor beyond the cement plant called Fen. The whole harbor's turned into a terrible stinking marsh and the water is full of gas anomalies. It's not even really water anymore, more like acid. People have found artifacts there before, but the place is also teeming with monsters.

Look in the old cement plant. Lots of anomalies, but it's worth it. Sure, there are spots where artifacts are easier to come by, but so's the competition. Here your only competition consists of hamsters, and that's only if you go down in the basement.

You should look near Oakpine. That's that thing growing between the hills, above the gas anomalies. Everyone's been calling it that since some geek identified the bark from that tree as both pine and oak. If you want to search for artifacts there, you'll need good chemical protection. Take lots of ammo, too, because those hills are home to packs and packs of dogs.

Sometimes you don't have to jump into anomalies to scare up an artifact. I've been told of an artifact found out in the open field. This one Stalker had a detector that started acting up, so he decided to change the batteries. As soon as he did, the detector shows a reading and bam, an artifact basically drops in his hands. Lucky bastard, eh? That's the Zone for you: sometimes it punishes you and sometimes it rewards you.

I've heard from seasoned Stalkers that sometimes artifacts move outside of anomalies. Your detector starts going "peep," you take it out, but there's nothing there. That means a 'nomadic' artifact walked past you but it's no use chasing it, because only the Zone decides who to reward it with.
No one has looked for artifacts in Pripyat yet. Everyone I know has only been here a short while, so they stay cautious.
I don't know if anyone knows the good spots. Pripyat is poorly explored so far.
I would look in the underground tunnels. They say there's tons of them underneath the city.

Not much is known about these parts. Garry's stories, mostly. He says there's a place here where a huge grapevine grows out of an acid anomaly, as tall as a ten-story building. He might be pulling our leg, but I'd check out that vine for artifacts just in case.

The surest place is the acid swamp. It's full of gravitational anomalies, but those are easy to spot. Just keep your eye on the water surface and you can't go wrong. Gas anomalies are more of a pain, because there's basically no air to breathe. Getting squirted by one is no fun, believe you me. That thing eats through a vest faster than sulfuric acid.

There are plenty of heat anomalies at the burnt farmstead up on the hill. People find fire artifacts there. Look in the houses: whichever's got the most anomalies in it after an emission, that's where the artifacts will be.

There's probably lots of them in the caves under the burnt farmstead. If you walk on the hill with a detector, it doesn't stop beeping. Getting to them is easy enough - just jump in through the gap from above. Getting out is the hard part, with all the anomalies down there. Mostly vortexes and acid. Some also claim to have seen something resembling a comet in that gap. A whole mix of dangers, to be sure, but that means the artifacts are probably mixed as well.

Have you seen a Circus anomaly? It's a huge springboard anomaly with two comets going round and round - quite a sight to behold. Behold it from a distance, though, because Circus is hot as hell, with lots of heat anomalies. It's got plenty of artifacts, too, but they're guarded by a nasty fire poltergeist that tries to roast you up when you come near.

If you're interested in gravitational artifacts, look for them in the Fang anomaly. The place is easy to spot - anomalies have done a job on the terrain, took half the hill clean off. A few caves opened up in the hill and were immediately settled by snorks. Thankfully, they rarely go outside.
Man, the only thing you'll get is a nightmare and that's pretty much it. A lack of sleep and a wet suit. Good luck with your search, Stalker.
If I were you, I would look for fresh water instead. Water keeps you alive here and artifacts only generate cash but maybe that's why you have come.
I don't know about artifacts really. They seem too radioactive and dangerous, if you ask me. I suggest you equip a quality suit if your are planning to search for these unearthly things.
Do you know some good place to search for artifacts?
I've already told you.
No, I don't know anything else.
That's all I know. Ask somebody else.
Anything interesting?
What's up?
You look tired, friend.
Hello.
What do you want?
What?
Start talking.
Hi, Major!
Hi, there!
I'm listening, Major.
Yeah, hi.
What?
The man himself.
Hey, Stalker. What's your hurry?
What's going on?
What, Stalker?
Oh hey.
Hi there.
Hey!
I shouldn't have come here!
Help me... God, I'm dying...
I need a medic!
Medkit! Anything!
Help me, Stalker... Ahh!
Gimme a medkit... Now!
Help me out here damnit!
I need a medkit... quick!
Help me, Stalker... a medkit, please!
I'm hurt... help!
Aahh ... fuck this place!
Medkit!

Have you heard about the dredge station east of Skadovsk? They say something weird glows there at night... Too weird even for the Zone, mind you. I really don't know if it's worth checking out. It might turn out to be something valuable, but is it worth risking my ass over? That's the question...

God has left this place. I've had nothing but rotten food since I came here two months ago. I think that worms are starting to crawl around inside me and I really am thinking of leaving this fucked up place soon.

Did you hear Sultan planned to take over Beard's business? Skadovsk ain't big enough for his greedy ass, so he wanted to grab an even larger piece of the pie... But we said, "No way, Josй!" Beard and the rest of our guys gave them hell all right. Sultan's thug operation won't fly here.

Wow, did you hear about this? That scumbag Sultan clamped down on Beard... I don't know what he did exactly, but it seems he turned on the meter on Beard! What's the Zone coming to? If they keep this up, Skadovsk is going to be a bandit base before you know it!

Word is that some Zoners here have come to collect personal items for the rich people outside the Zone. You know an artifact can generate huge amounts of cash, right? Maybe that's why you came yourself? But let me tell you this... it's not worth the risk, buddy. People are disappearing from this terrible place for lots of reasons. Stay alert and make sure that you drink lots of canned water or else your mind starts to play tricks on you, I tell ya.

Let's see... You should conserve your ammo. I know that Owl keeps some in the back of his shop but he won't sell more than one clip of each caliber. Also, he raised his prices on pretty much everything as he knows that we Zoners really need his gear out here... Oh, and scientists are tinkering with some artifact in their bunker as we speak. Some new find.

Did you hear about Topol? He found some new shithole for his guys to wander into, and of course, they happily went for it. Their escapades ended up with a controller ironing their brains out. They would be pissing all over themselves in hospital bunks if it weren't for this one Stalker that was with them. When Topol came to his senses from that zombification crap, that poor chap was squatting down right next to the controller, cutting its ears off.

Did you hear about the Kopachy village? When the original disaster hit the Chernobyl NPP, that area got it so bad that they decided to bury the whole village. Nothing but small radioactive mounds there now, in place of houses. They say it was an eerie place even before the disaster; I shudder to think what one might find there nowadays. Everyone's too scared to check it out. But what if they're wrong - it could be an artifact goldmine for all we know!

When Duty came to Yanov station, Freedom fighters were already there. As could be expected, things got ugly quickly. Both factions suffered heavy losses, even a few free stalkers were hit by stray bullets. That's when Zulu told them an emission was coming. Left with no choice, Duty and Freedom called a truce and dug in at the station. When it was all over, Zulu quit Duty and settled down at the tower near the station.

Have you trie Beards mushroom tea yet? The taste really is something for dogs only but I just find it to be one of my favorite drinks now... besides clean water. But where can we find any of that? It's like this place has lost its last good items worth stealing... Well, I recommend that brown hot tea for ya'. It also takes away some of that fucking constant hunger.

I saw a man ripped apart by one of those freaking mutated dogs. His face must have smelled like a delicacy to them. If I only had a few more bullets, I would have shot every single one of those doggies.

Have you tried the bread? Mind that there two kinds around. A clean one and an old one. Don't spend any money on the latter, it will make you sick. I had nothing but a blurred vision and a pain in my stomach the last time I ate that shit. And no medic could help me, I just had to wait it out, puking constantly. Stick to canned food that you can buy on Skadovsk.

That new Duty squad, you know... They just about crystallized out of thin air. Think about it: a group of Duty fighters leave Yanov and come back three times as many. Are they cloning themselves or what? I guess you should expect that from Duty, though. Only way they tell each other apart is by rank!

That new Freedom squad, you know... They just about crystallized out of thin air. Think about it: a group of Freedom fighters leave Yanov and come back three times as many. I got an idea - they're multiplying by budding! You'd think so, wouldn't you? All that grass they're smoking, they're about to take roots and start vegetative reproduction!

Know Gonta and his guys? They were down on their luck for a while, with Danila disappearing and Crab getting wounded. But they're on a good streak now. They're making out nicely with the scientists, taking measurements for them. Nice, eh? A cushy job and a surefire step toward getting their official permits.

Heard about stalkers called Mitay, Torba and Grizzly? I hear they got a job with the scientists, taking measurements. What the heck is that about? If you ask me, those eggheads are up to no good. But hey, at least the guys are taking it easy now. They might even get their official permits one day.

Know Spartacus and his crew? Well, you won't see them at Skadovsk anymore - they're guarding the scientists' bunker now. Why not - they can handle mutants all right and know how to keep the bandits at bay. Science is a worthy cause that could use some peace and quiet.

Have you seen them mercenaries kicking heels at the substation? Not recently you haven't. They've gone over to Jupiter to guard the scientists' bunker. There had been some other mercs guarding the place before them, but something happened to them, I hear. Ain't a bad trend if you ask me! Some mercs disappear, others take their place and follow suit... A few more rounds like that and we'll be rid of mercs at Zaton altogether.

Folks say the scientists' bunker is now being guarded by the valiant warriors of Duty... I wonder what's in it for them? Do they really believe those 'ologists' will get them a brand new plasma gun to go hamster-hunting? Guards my butt, heh...

They say the scientists' bunker is now being guarded by Freedom. Aren't the scientists afraid that their test specimens can go up in smoke - I mean literally? There's a bright side to it, though. If anyone tries to attack the bunker, they'll have to get through a smoke screen first! Ha-ha-ha!

Have you seen Jupiter, the radio electronics plant? A creepy place that is. No one really knows what goes on in there. The anomalies and mutants are just like everywhere else... But I still don't feel like going there. My gut's telling me that place is trouble.

Lookie here, ain't you that dude who exposed the Skadovsk medic? 'Preciate that, I really do. I coulda been his next patient, ya know... We all thought it was the monsters, but I guess some people can be just as bad. We live in a dog eat dog world, ain't that the truth?

I should be asking you that. After you went into those tunnels beneath Jupiter, we heard rumors you reached as far as the center of the Zone. Caused a real turmoil. Got a dozen people itching to follow in your footsteps. Nitro cooled them off, though - he said the tunnel gates closed shut and he couldn't do nothing to reopen them. Sure, we had a few desperados who wanted to blow up the gate, but they're still trying to work out where to get enough dynamite and how they're going to breathe once they actually get down there.

Oh, have you heard the latest about Garry? The Stalker who used to work for the scientists. He's no longer a 'trespasser' - he's got an official Zone permit, believe it or not! So, you're thinking he should have picked up his loot and gone home, right? Well, instead the crazy bastard got up and went for Pripyat. Everyone thought he was gone for good, like the rest, but far from it. He made it, but his feat wasn't much use to stalkers. He ran into some military guys. Now Garry's cool with the jarheads, having a permit and all, but the area is still off-limits to regular stalkers.

Well... Freedom and Duty are fighting again, this time over some major stash. They say there was enough gear in there to equip three infantry divisions. Don't know who made the stash in the first place, but the showdown was really something. Stirred up all the stalkers at Yanov, but luckily, they stepped aside or we'd have yet another free-for-all. I guess Duty got the worst of it, 'cause now the area is guarded by Freedom squads.

Well... Duty and Freedom are fighting again, this time over some major stash. They say there was enough gear in there to equip three infantry divisions. Don't know who made the stash in the first place, but the showdown was really something. Stirred up all the stalkers at Yanov, but luckily, they stepped aside or we'd have yet another free-for-all. I guess Freedom got the worst of it, 'cause now the area is guarded by Duty squads.

Something happened recently. A group of stalkers were exploring the Jupiter tunnels and stumbled into something - I mean someone. First their guns came flying out of their hands, and then all kinds of crap went flying straight at them. They got no clue what the hell actually happened, but they lost two boys in there.

I heard they found some kind of gross mutant shit in the tunnels north of Jupiter. Trapper sent a Stalker in there to investigate. Turned out there used to be a burer lair. Why "used to be"? 'Cause that same Stalker wiped out all the burers. On his own... You even seem to fit his description, except he's a bit taller and always carries a grenade launcher.

Stalkers are done for... Monsters are coming from Fen. Stalkers at the cement plant saw them lugging off one of our guys. There was at least a dozen of them, huge-ass bastards like you won't believe. Looked like bloodsuckers, only twice as big and much faster. We are praying Trapper figures out how to deal with those beasts...

You heard about swamp bloodsuckers? The ones in Fen? Well, they're gone. Trapper came for 'em... Not personally, though - he hired some Stalkers. They say he put a crew together, about ten men or so, and combed that swamp through and through, and whatever jumped out they blasted to kingdom come. Ain't a frog living in that place no more.

It wasn't long after word began to spread about a chimera that someone popped it. Mutants used to kill Zoners by the dozen, but I guess we're finally wising up and reversing the trend. I also heard from other sources that the guy was an experienced hunter who has killed more monsters than you and I killed mosquitoes in our lifetime.

Have you heard the kind of people Freedom recruits nowadays? There was this fella called Flint, bragged left and right about his escapades and trophies... well, he turned out to be the scum of the earth. Left his buddy to die in an anomaly, grabbed his loot and took off. Later they uncovered more of his exploits over at Zaton, where he basically fed a group of hunters to a chimera. I used to think better of Freedom... Hell, I'd rather be factionless than have friends like that.

Well, they put down that chimera at Zaton. Gonta's crew with an unknown Stalker. Wait, that was you, wasn't it? Maybe you could give me a first-hand account? Thanks a million, by the way - that's one less man-eating mutant to worry about!

Don't know if it's newsworthy, but we got this Noah fella here, the loopiest headcase you will ever meet. He's got one ugly barge... Looks like he had a bunch of illegals build it in a week, heh. Watch out for him, he shoots first and doesn't even bother to ask questions later. I say, to hell with that asshole.

You know this cat Nimble? Yeah, he's sneaky all right. Sells the best shooters around, no doubt. I wonder how he smuggles them like that. I mean, how do you carry a Vintar so it don't look like you do? Where do you stick that thing? That's some wizard shit right there, man.

Word on the street is, Sultan's stepped into some deep shit. The don wanted to bust up Beard and take his business under, but he bit off more than he could chew. Got a mouthful instead. He's got rough times ahead with his crew looking at him all sideways. Ain't got the same weight anymore.

Word is, Sultan's got Beard in the palm of his hand, juicing his business. That's good shit and Sultan's got a lot of weight now, but the best thing is we can run Skadovsk our own way now. It's gonna be beautiful. Looking for cover from an emission? No problem, just fork up the toll!

Hey man, you hear about the Oasis? Picture that, a place that instantly heals all your pains and sicknesses. It's gotta be some kinda trick or magic... I got another idea, though. There's all this buzz about the Oasis, but not a word about the Wish Granter like it used to be. Well, maybe the Oasis is actually someone's wish come true?

There's talk among the eggheads of some artifact dragged here all the way from the Oasis. But get this: once they study it, they're gonna use their research to come up with a cure for cancer! Word up!

Same shit, different day... Everyone's digging up old stories about the center of the Zone. Like the one about the Oasis - a place that instantly restores all your energy and heals your wounds. It's pure, unadulterated bullshit, but fun to listen to. Especially when they talk of its location. Oh, I wish there was a place like that for real... we'd have saved so many of our boys.

I heard through the grapevine that they've found the Oasis. I'd have never thought it existed, but facts are a stubborn thing. An artifact was found on location. Scientists are studying it as we speak. Perhaps they can use it to make some ultra-fast healing device... Our boys sure could make use of that.

Kopachy. Nothing new to the Zone, but new to me. Just imagine - a whole village with houses buried up to their roofs in the ground... Dating all the way back to 1986... the houses emitted so much radiation, they had to bury them. A chilling sight...

You know the story how Duty and us ended up rooming together at Yanov? That was all Zulu. He was in Duty back then, and he could smell an emission approaching like no one else... But we came to Yanov first; after Stalkers, that is. We barely had time to light up a smoke when those half-assed GIs turned up, waving their shooters at us. The last time I saw that kind of carnage was back at the Garbage over a year ago. Tons of guys dead on both sides. Our emission specialist among them, God save his soul. That's when Zulu goes, "Emission coming! Take cover!" What were we supposed to do, kick them out and let them die? Duty or not, they're still human. That's how we live now: we squabble when it's quiet, but when an emission hits, we sit tight, side by side. Zulu, he ended up leaving Duty. He lives as a hermit near Yanov now.

It ain't no news and no secret neither, but Cardan the technician is on his way to drinking himself to death. They say he started out easy when he came to Skadovsk, drinking only on occasion or for antirad purposes. It wasn't until later that he really began to belt the grape, grief-stricken by the death of his two friends. They must have been really close...

Here's a funny story. When you take a nap in your filthy sleeping bag, some cockroaches and spiders that are attracted to your body heat will find their way to your mouth. Imagine that! If you are hungry, you just have to go to bed! Ha! No, let me tell you: those face masks are not just there to make people look badass.

Did you hear about the Kopachy village? When the original disaster hit the Chernobyl NPP, that area got it so bad that they decided to bury the whole village. Nothing but small radioactive mounds there now, in place of houses. They say it was an eerie place even before the disaster; I shudder to think what one might find there nowadays. Everyone's too scared to check it out.

This isn't news, but maybe you haven't heard it. We didn't jump in bed with Freedom 'cause we like to snuggle. We owe it to chance. When we came here, Freedom pounced on us out of nowhere... Losses were great on both sides, though we were slowly but surely gaining an edge over the anarchists... But as the fight was in full swing, Zulu sensed an emission approaching. He's never wrong, you know... We had no choice but to put the fighting on hold. What I don't get is why Zulu left Duty after that incident...

Our scouts won't be around for much longer. They forgot their purpose here and to tell you the truth so did I... Or at least I really can't see any good reason to stay here now except for looting the houses of the Chernobyl workers...

You were the one who brought that PDA to Loki, right? Man, it's the shiznit. The legendary founder of Duty, General Tachenko, conned his own soldiers like some suckers. Broke the radio so they couldn't be reached from the outside, formed his own following of knuckleheads... only to croak in true retard fashion in an effin' space bubble! You couldn't make this shit up, man!

Seen the new squad those half-assed GIs been fieldin'? Can't be reinforcements from their base - the ideology hasn't yet replaced good sense altogether. But they're too well trained to be plain Zoners. Who the hell knows. Could they be from the Monolith? I know, that sounds crazy!

Seen our new fighters? Oh, you brought them here, didn't you? You rock. They're pretty cool, kinda tense though... That's OK, a few months of hanging with us will free their minds. They'll start digging our way of life and become like us soon enough.

We've got some cool new recruits: a squad of former Monolith fighters. And not some rookies either, these are trained fighters. Of course, their heads haven't quite clicked into place after leaving the Monolith. That's all right though, we've got a special Ideology 101 crash course for that, and much more.

They say Freedom has recruited some former Monolith fighters. Hard to believe, but they do have a new squad and it definitely didn't come from outside the Zone. I guess they're pretty desperate... that or their brains have completely withered from all those drugs. Who are they gonna recruit next, a zombie brigade? A burer battalion?

This area will soon have law and order again. Duty has taken control of key local positions. We've secured a firm footing at Yanov, and we've got a 24/7 protection detail at the scientists' bunker. It's high time for Freedom to pack their things and hit the trail - anarchists aren't welcome here.

Beware, brother. Devils dwell in this place. And I am not talking about those tormented pigs that you can find almost everywhere. I am talking about some black souls that hide in the hills with their camouflaged equipment and constantly on the lookout with their scoped rifles. Maybe they're former Russian soldiers that got fucked up in the head but if I were you I wouldn't camp in the open.
I think it was you who helped our guys get that job guarding the scientists, wasn't it? Thanks for that. It sure was nice to see our men at the bunker instead of those friggin' mercs. Good stuff!

Let's see... we're getting a kick from Duty's secret stash. Now we'll use the stash for its intended purpose - as a prison for Duty scum to press them into divulging all their secrets. He-he. Oh, and thanks for tipping us off about the alarm system - without reinforcements we didn't stand a chance.

Another victory for Duty! Those anarchists really got too big for their britches... Snuck into our secret warehouse, thinking they could get away with it. Hell no! We surprised them and blew their heads off like rabid hamsters.

It ain't news that Freedom is a bunch of lowlifes, but we've uncovered something new about one of their biggest wackos. This hood went by the name of Flint in Freedom, but before he joined he was Magpie, a Loner. At least Magpie was his name when he came to Zaton and almost led a crew of hunters right into mutants' jaws. He set them up so that a chimera almost tore them to pieces, while this bastard grabbed their equipment and came here to Yanov. After joining Freedom, he threw his partner into an anomaly to take away his artifact. So, that's Freedom for you.

I think of leaving this Chernobyl nightmare soon. I've managed to find some old books on one of the ships here. I've already gotten in touch with my contact outside the Zone and he's turning them into cash as we speak. I suggest you do the same thing and keep away from the center of Pripyat. There is plenty of loot to make you rich even here. Just search well and you will succeed.

Have you met Nimble? He's on Skadovsk right now. He's a real pro of his trade. He can get you anything you need. Well, almost anything. He's focused on shooters and suits lately, but always top of the line! Specialty items, experimental designs, hand-crafted articles... His stuff ain't cheap, but why should it be? Exclusivity costs a pretty penny!

Did you know Pilot has been using a new route between Zaton and Jupiter? It used to take a long while - walking uphill, dodging anomalies and so on. Now it's a piece of cake. Not a journey but a walk in the park, not to mention it's half as long. But Pilot gives credit where credit is due - he wasn't the one to discover the route. A Stalker showed him his maps. For a fee, of course, but he didn't charge an arm and a leg either.

Why are you here, Stalker? Some pieces of shit are here out of curiosity or even just for the hell of it. Knifing those bastards usually makes me very happy, but most of the time I stick to the job. You see, I'm here for the job, whatever that might be. I'd rape a fucking flesh if I could get some money out of it. See, I don't care, I know what I'm here for, and none of these idealistic bastards could ever say that. So think about it. But don't think too much or you might end up in a ditch.

I wonder what those freaking "animal rights" activists would say about the way we treat animals here. Fuck, are those things even "animals"? I call them hell spawns, and I usually shoot them in the face, because that's what you do to hell spawns, you don't protect them, feed them or, God forbid, nurture them. You fill 'em with lead and you move along before their friends arrive.

You want excitement? Is this place too boring for you? Go say hello to a snork or a bloodsucker. If you're polite enough, they won't even get aggressive. It's weird, I had this one friend, he robbed people for a living, and he was dead set on doing this shit. I haven't seen him since but it sure is worth a try, don't you think? It's strange why not many people have tried this, it's bound to work, you don't even have to carry any weapons.

My grandfather fought for the country, my father died for this piece of land and I'd be damned if I let this black hole eat my motherland away. The last thing my grandfather said before he succumbed to the crippling cancer was that I need to take care of my land. That is what I'm doing here, or rather was what I was supposed to be doing here. Things have changed now, I'm not even sure who I'm supposed to fight for. I had to put a bullet through the spine of a good friend of mine. The fool didn't "believe" in emissions, so when a psionic storm hit, he was out gathering flowers or doing some other stupid shit. Afterwards, he went insane and started shooting at everyone and everything. I had to take him down. The same guy that I shared food with, the same guy that saved my ass every time I fucked up. What am I supposed to tell his kids now? Fuck this place.

They say that I made a mistake coming here. They're a bunch of cowards. I'd rather be here than stuck behind some shitty desk. That's what would really finish me off, not a mutated puppy, but mindless, endless paperwork. Demons live inside those gigantic stacks of papers, not under Pripyat sewers. This is where I belong, and this place is where I can actually be myself. Camo suits me much better than any tie, and a rifle speaks in a much clearer voice than any "president" or "director".

Check the sky and the surroundings as often as you can. The moment you don't look, all hell will break loose, emissions will appear and mutants will bite your ass off. Fight sleepiness by taking caffeine, eating food, just do whatever you need to do to keep awake. I sleep for only two or three hours a day, and always with a shooter beside me. This is something you either do, or you don't, and if you don't, you'll be pushing up daisies in no time. Keep that in mind and get your shit together.

People do drugs here, it's shit and it fucks them up real bad, but you do whatever you can to survive. If that means doing coke probably cut with detergent, then it's coke and detergent all the way. I've seen some guys that won't even touch the food unless they're high on some crap. I'd wager if they don't get their daily fix, they would rather starve to death than eat food that usually smells of dog piss. Junkies don't live long enough here though. If you get addicted, the first thing you start doing is thieving, later you join the bandits, but soon enough you start thieving from them, and that's when your life story ends and you get cut up like a pig or thrown into a snork hole. Don't fuck with the bandits, and don't fuck with drugs "too much."

When that cold sweat hits you after you haven't eaten for more than a day, that is exactly when your immune system goes on a fritz and you won't be able to hold a pencil steady, let alone a machine gun. People start hallucinating and walk into trouble or right off a cliff. Fill your belly at least once a day, and if you can't afford Beard's delicious delicacies, then eat some worm-infested meat that you cut out from a mutant. Worms are cheap when compared to, well... death. I've seen people outside survive whole months without food, but here it's another story. The Zone drains you. Drains your spirit, your willpower and your body. Don't hesitate to feast on snorks if you really have to. Cannibalism isn't exactly welcome, but if nobody sees you, it shouldn't really be a problem.

I've seen grown men turn into crying babies here. They just can't keep up and succumb to the pressure. Even athletes and people with superb physical condition drop like flies after a few squats here in the Zone. This place is a thief and a very nasty one at that - it takes away a part of your soul every day, and doesn't give it back. I could easily lift 30 kilos before I came here. Now I can barely lift a grenade when faced with a swarm of those tushkanos. It might be fear too, but whatever it is, it's like a heavy burden we all carry, we all share. Next time you want to drop a bandit when you have the upper hand, remember what I said about the burden, he is carrying it too, just like you.

Next time you face a pack of dogs, try running directly towards them, it might actually save your ass from turning into dog food. We eat them, they eat us, it's a symbiotic thing. But yeah, feel free to try it out, but leave your weapons behind so you’ll be able to run faster and be more intimidating. You might just leave them with me, I can keep them safe while you try this out for yourself. This shit works, but most Stalkers are fucking cowards and don't have the balls for it.

Get a good knife, best one of those that could shave boar's balls by looks alone. You know, quality brand knives. Get some oil on the knife, make it nice and shiny so that you can see your reflection in it. Then stab some poor fool in the throat, plunge the knife all the way to the hilt and wiggle it a bit. Soon enough, he will start bleeding out and losing consciousness, but - just a moment before he does - stare deep into his eyes. That way, your face, the face of his killer, will be the last thing he ever sees, he will take it to the grave, and the underworld will know about you. I've done this countless times, and I bet down under the ground they know my name and surname by now. When they know about you there, there is no reason to send their minions for you. I myself haven't seen a freaking bloodsucker for months now, they already know about me. This is why I will survive longer than those other cowards.

I played the violin back home. Was one of the best, I even had the chance to meet the president twice. I knew the strings so well I could caress them in ways other violinists could only dream of. When I was recruited in the army, I thought I'd do my duty, go through a couple of years for my country, then get back to doing what I love. They sent me here, right after bootcamp, and I've been here ever since. Back home, they expect me to return to my previous glory and brilliance, but they don't know what happened here. It's this evil shit, the radiation or the Zone itself. It seeps into me each day, and my hands tremble, my bones hurt. I play some guitar once in a while, but that piece of rotten wood sounds like chimera claws ripping your guts. But that's the only way to keep my sanity. I feel that the guitar takes me back a bit closer to the beauty of before, the strings, the music, but at the same time it hurts me deeply knowing that I could never be that person again. If only I had a violin here, any would do, I could maybe once again take a whiff of the time before I died inside.

Before all these scientists and mechanics came to the Zone, Stalkers used to carry artifacts on these makeshift belts with crude boxes attached to them. A whole generation of Stalkers are now sterile and slowly dying, their insides turning into liquid that they have to puke out once in a while. I don't know how they stay sane, how they don't just off themselves. If those simple boxes were damaged even a tiny bit, the radiation slowly entered their bodies, and that happened quite often. Now we have artifact containers that are quite durable. I've seen bullets deflecting of those contraptions, they make them as rough as those black boxes on airplanes. We have it easy now, think about the first wave of Stalkers that conquered the Zone, they were the true heroes. They didn't have any manuals nor the tools and couldn't enjoy the comfort of bases. Left completely on their own, they had to make up new ways to survive. Those boys were the pioneers.

I had this buddy who fought off two chimeras. Just imagine, in front of him there were two hulking monstrosities of flesh and claws, filled with a fair share of human flesh and craving for more. He was right to be afraid. He had his back to a wall, down on his last 20 buckshots and a few bombs. He was a good aim, but that is not why he survived. He had a few of these stimpacks. I call them boosters, because they sure work fast. Whenever the chimeras struck him down and he thought he couldn't get up again, he would fix himself up with those things. Crafty fellow, that one. And you know, the human body is actually quite the resilient mother fucker. We aren't usually used to life-threatening situations and we don't have to fight off two-headed beasts to stay alive very often, but when we do, our body works wonders especially if you give it a tiny push. I don't know what long term consequences those chemical nightmares have, but if you cared about long term consequences, you wouldn't be prying around in the Zone in the first place.

Shit ain't rosy outside either. My mom used to send me some cookies with sugar every few weeks and some letters telling me how they're doing. She always keeps a brave face, writing how everything is just dandy and that they are quite content, but I can see that the cookies have less and less sugar every month, and the handwriting is getting worse too. At first, she used clean white paper, but now it's this awful greasy paper probably found in some shit dumpster. I can't summon up courage to ask how they're really doing. I'm scared shitless of what they would say to me, even though I already know. I just don't want to read about it. The mental image of my folks being OK is what keeps me going around here, I don't care if it's false, I've got nothing else anymore. I send them whatever money I earn. Yesterday I sent them some that I made by selling off the last of my food rations. I'd be OK, I can always try my luck at the anomaly casino. Losing a bet there isn't the most healthy thing in the world but I'll take my chances.

I've got it, man, I've got the bug. They told me like it didn't mean shit to them, like reading a booklet about breeds of kittens. They told me I had AIDS and even told me to leave the room when I was still in shock. Fuck those people, you know? They study for so long to be perfect doctors, with a career and everything, but they end up being completely desensitized to everything. Like talking to a snork. The snork would've reacted in a more humane manner, this shit ain't right. And I have to pay heaps of money every month to get the anti-retrovirals. That shit does not come cheap, not even that knockoff Chinese shit that is only available in the Zone. I might be getting placebo pills for all I know, I still feel like crap. The Zone is the best I can do right now. And here I am, 3 years and counting. But I see you have your own shit to take care of, so just walk away like everyone does. Just leave me the fuck alone.

Money. Cash. Heaps of notes with as many zeros as possible. I can see your eyes light up like an emission. So I guess I have your attention now. But it's no walk in the park, and not everyone does it, and that is why it's so rewarding. I don't tell this shit like this to everyone, you know? But you look like the right guy, so listen up. Listen very carefully and try to remember every single word I tell you. What you should do to get filthy rich very quickly is: "WORK HARD AND DON'T WHINE ALL THE TIME". You lazy fucking bastard. Bugger off and go mind your own bloody business.

The moment I took a single step inside the Zone was the first moment I felt really free. It was also the first moment I've ever realized that I didn't feel free back home. I thought I was fine working at the docks, bringing in some good money, joking around with friends. I had the average Joe's dream life. Some people think I must be insane for abandoning all that for the Zone. Some get really angry, one little shit even tried to shoot me. They don't know how to enjoy life, how to breathe in a new day, with new possibilities and new challenges. I know it's hard, but if you manage to survive here, even a single day, you've done more than any of the people back home would ever do. We've lost it, man, as humanity, we've been over-civilized, and have lost what it means to be alive. You are constantly reminded of it here, but back home you simply don't realize it. Just yesterday I was taking a dump in some bushes, like a real Stalker, and these bees just appeared. Angry little bitches. So I covered my face with my gasmask and started to run as fast as hell. I was so focused on running that I ran directly into a herd of hungry dogs. This is how my day started, and those 5 kilometers I ran were the daily reminder that I was alive and free.

There was this broad I knew, and I knew her well, if you know what I mean. But that bitch was just fucked up, she always kept tabs on me, checked where I was, kept calling me, leaving me strange messages. I told her this shit between us wouldn't work. She went fucking insane and started hitting me. See, I have nothing against hitting a woman, actually it's quite a relief of pent up frustration, especially with a psycho like that bitch. So I left her in front of the hospital. I think that was cool enough of me, right? I know some guys that would bury her corpse or chop her up so she could fit in the drains. I'm a good guy, you see, I take care of my bitches, but when they give me shit, that's it, I snap. Fuck, I'd really want to do her right now.

Don't wait for the siren before an emission. The sirens are always too late and if you're not close to any solid structure, you will get fried quite nicely. To stay alive and to avoid being fried, keep an eye towards the sky. If you see this odd cumulonimbus cloud formation, haul ass. And be quick about it. If a snork lair is your only option, go for it. You'd love those snorks compared to what the emission would do to you. So remember, when a thick vertical cloud formation appears in the sky looking as if God is puking his entrails from up above, that is when you say goodbye to all your heavy items, and sprint towards a safe spot. I had this one guy that wanted to have a tour around the Zone, he was some rich brat, constantly high on some shit and drunk. Well, that prick had the an opportunity to witness an incoming emission, and instead of taking cover like non-idiots like us, he stayed outside to admire the "beauty of the emission". His exact words. As I said, he was quite rich, so I picked up some nice loot from his scarred carcass and one torn picture of a cute girl. Shit, that photo is probably doing the rounds right now among the Stalkers.

This place isn't made for the likes of me. I'm not made for the likes of this place. I'm talking about the world, not the Zone. I've been having these clusterfuck migraines since I was little. My folks thought I was lying all the time and told me to "suck it up". Only when I started bleeding from my ears on a regular basis they started to take notice. It was all too late naturally, I was much older then, and I decided to pack my things and say hi to the Zone and goodbye to the outside world. And guess what? My migraines miraculously disappeared once I came here. I was overjoyed. For the first time ever I could feel this weight lifted off my shoulders, it felt very liberating. I could smell things, I could focus my eyes well and concentrate on the good things for a change. So I started really enjoying my life when I actually came to what many people call hell. Most were perplexed by my demeanor and I made some enemies along the way. You can't fit in over here unless you have that dreary, miserable outlook. They wouldn't accept me as one of them, neither Duty nor Freedom. I took it upon myself to find somewhere to live, further away from the pessimism of regular Stalkers. I stayed in this makeshift hut I built of metal parts, buried under some concrete slabs. I was quite content, and the place seemed to shield me from emissions quite well, but there was this familiar feeling coming back to me. It even made me feel a bit nostalgic, before I realized the migraines were coming back. Now they are worse than before, my ears burn up, I can't see well, and I can barely hold a gun because of those clusterfucks. I just want everything to end right now.

Holy shit, I can't take this anymore. The ladies, I really miss 'em. I had a ton of girls back home, they liked the muscular types, I liked the big-boobs type. We had an understanding. But here, I haven't even seen a female nipple! And I'm not touching those magazines Beard sells. They're all greasy and sticky, I don't want to know how they became that way. There were so many women in this place before 1986, before it became a radioactive desert. Parties, music. Communist music, but music nonetheless. Now I get turned on by their ghosts. I think about how many fish there were in the pond at Skadovsk or Yanov. I bet there was enough tail to last a lifetime. This is bullshit, I gotta get laid. Hey, on a completely unrelated matter, do you know where that herd of fleshes was killed recently? I'm actually going for a walk.

Have you heard about that quick release system? That thing saved my ass when I ran into a massive herd of boars and fleshes. I took some very, very nice loot from what looked like a Duty graveyard. There were literally dozens of bodies along with all their equipment, guns, artifacts, I couldn't believe my eyes. I actually had to leave some artifacts behind, and I never do that, ever. But I was packed to the gills, and felt like a mule right before his back snapped. So it’s time to cash it in, I thought. While I was slowly walking towards the base, I was mumbling to myself: "not now, please not now, just not today, please", and then the low pitched roar of a boar cut my prayers in half. I started running away from the sound, but this air is not good enough for that. It was like made of 95% nitrogen, and each time I breathed in, I choked. So I had to make a decision, I had to leave the loot. When that backpack slammed to the ground like a fucking meteor, I sprang forward like a gazelle with grace and whatnot, the air had oxygen in it once again. Later I came back to the stash, some artifacts were missing, but there was also some blood and a nice chunk of what looked like human flesh near it. Someone tried to take a swipe at the backpack, but was probably hunted down by those boars. Maybe they were guarding it while I was gone. I have newfound respect for boars. Haven't eaten boar meat since.

Sometimes you'll find some real nice food. You could snack on some nuts, fairly good meat or clean bread. But there are other times, whenever those emissions hit hard and often, where restocking isn't so easy, so the choices are either to eat shit, or dine on some shit. The irradiated chops Beard sells at his place will fill your belly no prob, but you gotta take care of those radiated particles. Remember to wash them down with something clean, like water or something stronger. There was this fat bastard that chugged down some 20 pieces of this infested grilled shit. He was so fucked up later, other Stalkers had to feed him antirad pills, and he had to pay them back later. Even eating food is dangerous here, so watch what you stuff in your mouth and you should be "almost fine" most of the time.

I'm an ex-military, trained by the best, conditioned to be a killing machine. I might look thin and scrawny, but underneath there are resilient and strong muscles. You wouldn't know what I'm talking about, I could break your neck before you could say "ouch". Just don't fuck with me and you'll be fine. I've rammed into so many boars with my fists, I don't waste ammo on those beasts. I punch them in their ugly muzzles until they just give up on life. I could show you if I wasn't so busy all the time. You should man up, do some push-ups, don't be such a chickenshit, huh? I'm sick of everyone asking for my help in taking down this chimera or sniping that controller from afar. I'd break this controller's neck, I don't snipe things like a coward. For me, it's only close and personal. Sadly, not everyone respects what I do. Some of those bitchy Stalkers would tell you that I'm making all this up. Don't you believe a word that comes out of their filthy lying mouths, they're simply jealous of my strength and prowess. Just don't tell them that I said this, OK?

What, you think you can just walk here and I'll start spilling my guts like a little baby? Everyone else might be doing it, just waiting for some poor sod to walk by and ask them how they're doing, but fuck you, friend, I'm doing swell, and I don't need anyone to hear my confessions. Now bugger off.
Just leave me be, I've got too many rads today, ain't my day.

I was once a lot like you, frightened, helpless and just an awfully pitiful sight. I fixed my attitude immediately after I was almost raped by those boar tusks. They cut you open just for the fun of it, I saw that happen to my buddy, he kind of took one for the team, I guess. I was so scared, I threw away my gun and ran towards cover like crazy. The first thing you have to do is get one of those armors, some thick stuff that would protect you from this awful environment. The more things you put between you and the freaks and monsters of the outside, the higher chances you'll have. There was this guy, he bought some modified exo, and just installed every single Kevlar piece he could find. He looked like a bloody Christmas tree and attracted a shitload of animals, but somehow he always got through. The cannon he was carrying sure helped increase his odds, but that exo with Kevlar works wonders here. I'm this close to getting one of those, if only I didn't have to feed the leeches back home.

Never trust those doctor fuckups. My granddad and grandma both got butchered by a surgeon. It was officially attributed to something else, but that doc was fucking drinking before the op. He reeked of booze and my granddad had to be operated right then and there. These Zone doctors aren't any better, they'd charge you and arm and a leg for fixing up a scratch, as if they've done a brain transplant twice. I take my chances and heal on my own. I'm just very careful not to get hurt, like obsessively careful, I don't drink and I don't take no drugs. But when I do get hurt, I just eat some good food, drink clean water and plop one of those emergency med kits. It usually is a bit cheaper, but most importantly if I fuck myself up, I'll have only myself to blame. I really don't want to end up like my grandparents, all cut up for no fucking reason.

I got one for you. NEVER STEAL FROM BASES. You can take anything you want everywhere else, whoever grabs it first, it's theirs. We aren't really fond of thieves around here. Even the bandits know to keep their hands off other people's shit. But if you're caught red-handed, you should feel lucky if you'll only hanged by your intestines on a tree.

I have seen those chickenshits, too careful what they eat, go broke from buying all this imported delicacies. I have seen idiots throw up all the food they just bought, because they didn't really care about the rads. Both of those fuckers are wrong. You need to have balance, Zen and whatnot, you know? As Aristotle said... nevermind that. When you can spare the time, swallow some shitty meat boiled in shittier stuff, and when you need to be "on the go", imported is what you need. Remember this lesson, and maybe you'll even save enough to buy yourself some shooter that won't break down after three shots at some sucker.

Back in the military in my home country we used to stuff our feet into the shoes along with a cloth of some sort, no socks. Those things were comfy if you know how to wrap your foot well, but most people were shit at it, and they had bruises the size of tushkanos on their feet. Those pansies got shot first. They were always too careful. Smart doesn't always work, you know. But back to the wraps: they dried well, they lasted a lifetime, and most importantly, they could be used for other "non-approved" ways. Smart guys used to carry two pairs of them along. Whenever one pair gets wet, they replace it with another, their feet always in a perfect shape, you could eat with those feet if only the toes were longer.

Sometimes it's not worth it. When you have heaps of loot, and dogs are after your ass, then it's time to drop some shit. Calculate what is worthwhile, if it's heavy and you won't need it too much, then you can casually leave a present for your attackers behind you. If it's small, light and expensive, then you don't part with it till you reach the base. I used to throw away things like that while running, and there would be a trail of useless junk behind me.

I save everything, I have never sold anything to any of those greedy bastard traders in the Zone. I keep everything in secret stashes all over the Zone, and they are really hard to find. I hoard things, and these are not some useless things you can find anywhere. One day they may be of some use, and I will stick it up the assess of all those amateur psychologists that diagnose me with ailments they've read in old magazines.

Some people only react when threatened. When you really need some loot, try shooting your prey in the legs or hands. When they lose their wits because of the agony, or just get scared shitless, you should have a nice chat with them, ask them where their stash is. Some fools will tell you, and after that you can do with 'em whatever you want. I caught a bandit and cut his trigger finger, after some time I saw him firing with the other hand at some Stalkers. Should've cut his head, that rat bastard.

The Zone has no mercy, ever. The Zone is living proof that God either does not exist, or doesn't give a fuck. Although He could be this mean bastard that wants to torture us, but that is almost beside the point. Don't expect anything good from anyone here. If I saw you with plenty loot, barely breathing and far from the base, I'd take a shot at you, do not think I won't. We are good buddies here, but outside it's a different matter. The Zone has its own rules, and we can only abide by them.

Respect the people of the Zone and the Zone itself. Always have at least a grain of respect, because without it we are just like animals, howling and giving in to their urges. Respect is what brings people to the Zone and allows them to stay alive. It doesn't care what you did or how you came here, who you are or where you come from, the Zone will cut you down if you forget respect. I keep a reminder of it right here in my pocket, always. It's one of my toes. One of those gravity anomalies almost sucked me in, and threw a piece of my foot 20 meters away. Had to crawl to bring it back to base for the doctors to stitch it back. But it was a bit too late, and now I carry it here. If you don't want to keep a reminder like this, you should always remember about respect.

I came here with only one thing in my bag and thanks to it I'm still here and not lying in a ditch somewhere, half eaten by mutants. My switchblade has been with my ever since boot camp. And I do take care of it, every time some gunk gets stuck into the mechanism, every time dirt and sand as much as touch my knife, I make sure to make it sparkly clean afterwards. It's my baby. I mean, it's common sense if you want things to last for life. And this cutter was made to accompany you all your life, if you take care of it. I cut meat, cut mutants, cut bandits and I even cut myself when I need some nasty insect larva removed. You can use it to open cans, open old locks, open up screws, open up someone's belly because they can't take a hint. Ammo you spend, grenades even more so, the knife stays with you forever, and it's a mark. It marks exactly what kind of a person you are.

You know why these fools carry around teeth with them? They think teeth of their enemies, especially golden teeth, carry the souls of their owners, so when shit hits the fan, you have someone to watch your back. These idiots don't realize how stupid they are, ghosts don't have eyes nor mouths, they can't even use weapons, for fuck's sake. How exactly are they going to watch their backs now, huh? Ah, sometimes people make me so mad I can't control myself and just put a bullet in their heads. After I'm done with them, I take their cherished golden teeth and sell them to whoever wants 'em, and I put some sand in 'em for good measure and so they won't tell enemies that someone is coming.

I have no friends, only some familiar faces. I know that guy, he sold me some food once, another one smiles like an idiot all the time. I don't even remember their names, they drop like flies so fast, it's not really worth it. And new ones come in by the hundreds, they're really like moths attracted by those fluorescent lights, just to be fried in an instant. That's a fitting description of the Zone, I think. Friends get you killed around here. What happens when he gets surrounded by snorks, and you have to "save" him because he's such a good friend? You die, right there and then. Instead of one, now there are two corpses. My only real friend is my gun, and if you have even a slightest interest in staying alive, then you should really cherish only your shooter and nothing else.

My family is shit, or rather is in deep shit. I mean, it's really bad back home. No food, no money. I send them money in this gray box, but they say only half comes to them. Always someone takes the other half. When I find that fucker, I will rape his face with my knife.

Do not touch junk that is not your own. Whatever it is. What if it's bottled anthrax? Do not throw it out, unless you wanna die a horrible death. Even if you find a hundred thousand in cash, even if you think you could just break away from the Zone and live like a king for a few months, you will get hunted down like a bloody animal. You were dead the moment you took that cash. So , keep your hands to yourself and to the things you personally own, everything else should be invisible to you. I hate telling this to every freaking newbie out here. No manners, these morons.

I've done it all, man, I've been here for so long. I've seen waves of pseudodogs flood bases, pseudogiants fighting between themselves, I've even seen controllers talk with people. Yeah, I've seen that. I smoked a ton of ganja before that, sure, but it was so that my head doesn't explode from the sound of those screeching auras those controllers emit. When you face them, whatever you do, just keep calm, and concentrate on either running away from the sound, or do the iron balls manoeuvre, that is run towards the sound and prepare to unload everything you have into their head. Would not recommend that one though. I've seen tough guys weep like little babies when they fail. Soon after they get mind snapped and they can't even be called people anymore.

Naturally, I'm the perfect man for this place. I'd say that I've got exactly what it takes to make it here. I was swinging through a bunch of prisons throughout Eastern Europe before I found this hellhole. Some of them were of better standard than some grade A hotels. Jesus, there was room service in one of them, how the hell was I supposed to repent for my crimes when it was so good to be there? I managed to escape from the last one, I shived a guard, didn't care whether he had any family, kids, lover, I didn't give not one fuck about it. So I came here, at least the prison here is much, much larger. It almost feels like freedom, and that's who I joined immediately when I arrived. Duty has their connections with the law. Me and the law don't get along actually. Some of the pussies in Freedom tell me I'm a monster, but once the real monsters come, guess who's gonna save their asses? But my speciality is murder, I can cut up a man faster than a pig, so they use me against Duty whenever the situation calls for it.

In here, you side either with people or with the mutant beasts roaming the place. If you are a beast, you'll get hunted for sure, if you are civilized enough and act like a person, you might survive for a while. We stick together, and that is why there are human settlements in this hell's kitchen. If we don't stick together, the Zone would turn into a wasteland of unseen proportions in no time. Even if it's a bandit roach, keep him alive, shoot him in the foot and get his stash, but leave him be. There is barely any people here, and you going around wasting good folks is not in anyone's interest. I know you want to be Rambo and are trigger happy all the time, but you won't be Rambo for long here. Rambos don't survive in the Zone for long.

Those fucks think they have it better than us. It is them that are prisoners, prisoners of comfort, prisoners of taking the easier path. They wouldn't last here. Not one of them would make it one day, it's going either going to be the food, or the air, or the hellspawns walking like they own the God damn place. If the Zone gets bigger and engulfs the whole world, we will be the most experienced and at the top, not them. They'd be hiding in some greasy corner with bags of gold and useless money. Try nibbling on a piece of gold, it doesn't do shit. I love their condescending tone, every time some new guy comes in and speaks to us, he acts all high and mighty, it's like we are living in a gutter, and they've come here to enlighten us. There was once a Christian missionary or a Muslim prophet, some prick like that. He came with food and medicine, promising the salvation of our souls. And virgins. Lots of pure virgins when we go to heaven. Not one Stalker bought his bullshit. Natural selection weeds out the idiots, or rather the Zone does, and those that are left? They don't value bullshit very highly. The guy that wanted to enlighten us was enlightened himself when he stepped into a lightning anomaly. He actually did survive, but he was badly burned and went back home immediately.

I heard about this guy that came to the Zone and refused to fire any weapons. He was a pacifist of some sort. Coward by my book, but that is irrelevant. Yeah, and he decided to stay here, make some money by helping the traders out, packing supplies, cleaning the beds, all those little things. At first, nobody respected him, they considered him a fool. After a while he started to grow on people, and they started to be dependent of him. He'd know who needs what, where and how. He actually sent money to that shitty country in Eastern Europe he came from. Imagine that, making money in the Zone without weapons? He is still a coward, but a crafty one indeed. He still has never left the base, and sends letters with cash back home. I think he has some family there.

Trading works around here for one reason: "shitty crook traders get fucked very quickly". There was this one lad, had the appearance of a soldier, that one. He started selling trinkets that were supposed to be half-artifacts. People bought it for a while, carried them around as if some new fashion trend started in the Zone. That kid got some money this way, started selling his goods to more experienced Stalkers, but they don't buy bullshit as you might have learned by now. So they took the so called artifacts to the scientists, they did some research and guess what happened to the kid? He might still be hanging by his intestines from those cranes up in Zaton. They didn't kill him immediately, no. They just ripped him open like a bag of chips, and hanged him by his guts to be pecked by birds like Prometheus. That is the way they die. I bet a lot of people saw that, and a lot of hopeful crooks took note and downsized their businesses.

I had that fucker as a landlord back in Kiev. He was a shitbag then, he's a shitbag now. He's even a worse shitbag now. I got into debt, did a little of those "games", had to try out my luck. I don't do that anymore, mostly because everything goes to the "landlord". He owns me, man, I've thought about putting a bullet through his head, but I'm not one of those people. It seems like I could never repay the debt I have, and I just go deeper and deeper. I think he's making money off me. At least my family back in Kiev has a roof over their heads. That is the least that I can do for them. He does take care of that part. I studied to become a technician, not a fucking hunter. Whenever I stab some poor flesh all I can think about is how disgusting this is, but this is how I keep my family safe back home. Should've accepted that job at the bank, what a fool I was back then. I had this superficial view on reality, and thought banks were just plain evil. You know, I thought banks were evil, but gambling isn't. I deserve rotting here in the Exclusion Zone.

You should be a rock, able to withstand waves of shit and gore that the Zone hits you with. But every rock needs its base. Nobody survives without some help. Either the mutants get you, or - if you're one of those nimble motherfuckers - some illness or even greed will get to you. Eat Zone-produced food only once in a while. If you overdo it after a day or two, you'll throw up more than you eat, it's really not worth it. The cancer should put you off too, but who the hell survives in here long enough to be diagnosed with cancer or actually die from cancer? That shit takes a while to develop and slowly engulfs your major organs. So be resourceful and visit the bases once in a while. Unload, unwind and talk to some people, one of those people might drag your unconscious ass back to base when a controller says "hello".

They say keep your friends close and your enemies closer. I like to keep everyone as close as possible. I keep an eye open at all times. Try catching me off-guard, even when I'm sleeping. I'm always alert and ready to kick some ass. But traveling alone is fucked up. I only travel with other Zoners. They know their fair share of terror, and they can keep their wits when everything turns upside down and you can barely tell a difference between a person and a mutant. You know, I'd love to keep them mutants close, but they do bite, and they sure bite deep. There was this one guy that kept a pseudodog, not sure how he tamed him, but he is one badass mother fucker right there.

It's called cumulonimbus cloud formation. 'round these parts it means it's high time to "get the fuck under cover." Those clouds resemble a nuclear explosion mushroom, but you'd pray it was a nuke if you actually get caught outside. Sometimes the emission just burns you until there is nothing but dust, sometimes electricity fries you like well-done bacon. But the psy storms are the worst. You can hear them speaking to you, and you must listen. The sound is so penetrating you'll think you've grown deaf. Some say psy storms are actually pent up psychic energy of controllers. So if you see this bizarre cumulonimbus cloud formation, stop whatever you're doing, and start working your way back to base. Emissions are the Zone's way to tell you: "you need a break."

I have these growths under my armpit and around my neck, doc says he can't do anything and when I ask him what it is, he just goes silent. Like a fucking light switch was turned off in his brain. Don't know what the hell that is, but I live with it. They are slowly getting bigger, I can't sleep on my back anymore. And the jacket I used to wear? I can barely zip it up. I might just be getting fat, I don't know, but who the hell gets fat in the Zone? I rub some imported vodka on my back and neck, and the feeling of tightness disappears for a while. Most think I'm a drunk because I reek of vodka all the time, and I go to bed with a vodka bottle. I've never drunk alcohol in my life, it's a religious thing so you probably wouldn't understand. Fuckit, I'll just head over to that other doc, he's always more helpful anyway.

You know that old newbie that hangs around the Yanov station? He's still a newbie for a good fucking reason. He tried to take some loot from another friend without him noticing. I'd call this theft, but the newbie is a good guy, and I don't want to see him hanging on a tree. So he took the stuff from his friend, and ran towards some stash he had previously prepared. We knew what he was doing all along, but tracked him anyway because we wanted to find out how he deals with this. Strangely, he returned all the loot and apologised to his friend for his nasty behaviour. He's been at Yanov ever since, washing dishes, tending to crates, moving ammo boxes. That's what you get when you fuck with other people's loot. Well, not really, you get hanged by your intestines on a tree, but that's what you get when you return the liberated goods back to their original owner on your own volition, realizing the mistake you've made. He's a good guy that one, but we all have our moments of weakness.

I had them in my sights, these mercs that were tormenting some Stalker by the rocks near Zaton plant. I could snipe them off in 4 seconds and it would've ended right there and then. I kept my cool though, and it really paid off because another dozen of mercs came afterwards. I didn't have enough bullets for all of them. I mean, I don't miss, I don't waste any bullets. I count every bullet by the price. If I shoot ten bullets, there will be at least ten corpses and I'd have to take "at least" that amount from their loot to break even. This is a good strategy for any visitor or long term Zoner here. When the mercs left, the guy was in so much pain I had to use one of my subsonic rounds with the suppressor not to attract unwanted attention. That was the only time I didn't calculate how much that bullet was worth. It probably meant everything to that tortured Stalker.

Nobody knows what the hell makes that pecker sound. Some think it's mutants, the controllers. Other say it's the weather. Still others claim it is antennas used for secret communication. This is what the rumors say, but what we know is that the Zone amplifies the signal and spreads it over a wider area, affecting any electronic device capable of emitting sound. Some people go insane from it, running into a boar lair or an anomaly. Never fall asleep where the sound is loud, you won't wake up the same as before. It fucks with your subconscious, you wake up and hear those unintelligible numbers and word combinations that make no sense. I don't quite understand what that might be, and I don't really want to find out. I just keep a nice distance from those sounds.

If you see the Z's, all faceless and slow, don't just spray them with bullets. That's like wasting money on slots. You won't gain anything by doing this. They are tough little bitches, and you won't be doing any good if you shoot them in the legs or arms. You could easily unload a crate full of ammo in those things, and won't so much as blink if the bullets miss the sweet spot. Don't waste money like that, it's useless. Aim for their spine or go for the head, and they'll be gone fast. Take your time, breathe steadily and be sure to exploit their weaknesses. Now that you know this, maybe you'll have better chances and won't end up filled with bullet holes.

Come, sit with me. Have a drink and relax. The Zone is unforgiving, but that doesn't mean Stalkers should be like that as well, right? We should enjoy these brief moments of peace because they may be our last. I knew this Stalker, he was always afraid, always kept an eye out for anything. Every little sound made him jump, wouldn't eat this, wouldn't drink that. Although he's survived until now, he's a wreck, he doesn't sleep, he doesn't leave the station, just too fucking scared of everything. If he took my advice and relaxed even a tiny bit, he'd be a different person now, but to each his own.

There was this one time I had to battle two hulking chimeras and these were no normal chimeras. They had three heads, man, that was insane. Even if you took care of two heads, there was still one more left. But it was no problem for my skills, you know? I kicked their asses so hard they bled like stuck pigs. I've done a ton of those things, man, no biggie. I once went to Pripyat after hearing all the stories of how fucked up it was. I had to get there, check it out myself. There were thousands of tushkanos, 50 monolith squads at every step, for real. I took down plenty of them but I couldn't carry anymore loot, so I got back here. By the way, do you have any idea how to release the safety on this piece of shit pistol? I couldn't figure it out, it's a new gun for me.

I'm sure you're eager to explore and wouldn't to find some shiny artifacts, but what if I tell you that the true treasure of the Zone are definitely not the artifacts? And that's exactly what I'm telling you, and to get that true treasure you don't have to fire a single bullet. I know it sounds too good to be true, but that is not a good enough reason to dismiss it. What I need from you is only an initial sum of money, think of it as an investment. And get this, it's going to spit out a return, ten times what you invested. I found this guy that knows this other guy who set all this up. It's all legit, you could ask around, but that would just make other Stalkers want to cash in, and this deal might not be on the table for long if that happens. Think about it and bring in the dough when you're ready.

I don't really talk to strangers, and we are all strangers here. Most people feel comfortable spilling their life stories to anyone, but I'm not that kind of guy. I realize it's that feeling of fraternity - anyone who isn't shooting at you is automatically your brother, and sharing a cup of shroom tea with another Zoner makes him your best friend. See, I never get used to that attitude, I've always been left to tend to myself. And that's alright with me.

Who are you living for? What is the "idea" that keeps you alive when every single thing in the Zone wants you dead? Imagine a democratic poll where everything in the Zone could vote, everything: the emissions, the anomalies, bandits, mutants, cancer, tetanus, radiation, etc. The odds are we would all be dead if things worked that way. The Zone wants you dead, but it even doesn't need to vote to get what it wants. Quite terrifying, ain't it? Do you know what keeps me breathing? These kind of conversations. Not vodka, not cocaine, not even those wonderful porn mags Beard sells for a hefty fee, it's simple chats with simple people like you. Thank you for taking the time to have a nice chat.

They sure put something in the imported tobacco that is being sold here, it reduces the effects of radiation and helps the body recover. Some fantastic shit the Ukrainian government came up with when they had to deal with the first Chernobyl explosion. So smoking one cig after eating some shitty cyst-infested meat from the Zone really works wonders. Unless you want to spend a whole day puking and get cancer in a few years. We are all sterile anyway, our balls can't handle the radiation, and those that aren't yet sterile have defective sperm. Imagine watching your beautiful wife give birth to a disgusting mutant, just because you spent a few months in the Zone back in when you were young. Everything has consequences, or at least that's what the doctors say.

Tag along with larger groups when you're not prepared for the horror of being alone. They won't mind unless you keep waving a shooter in their faces. That way you get the safety of numbers, you have more fun and you might learn a thing or two from their conversations. You could also learn by watching them in action. Their tactics, how they handle weapons, how they move. It's all important and essential if you want to stay alive. If not, you could join the ranks of zombies if that shit fancies you. Just walk to their lair or chill outside while a psy emission is raging. I wouldn't recommend any of these things though, but it's your call.

The scientists are good folk, they are timid like rabbits. They wouldn't blow directly on a flower, let alone kill someone. I salute them, they are so dedicated to their cause in spite of such harsh conditions. It's hard going on each day knowing that your bunker could be overwhelmed by the scum of the Zone, and you can't do anything about it. I'd rather have basic knowledge of gun handling, but these are educated people, people with a cause. I'm here because I need to sell artifacts. It helps with my terrible habit of collecting money. I've been doing that all my life, spending as little as possible, and I still ended up here. I seem to be saving in all the wrong ways, I guess. You have to think of some sort of system to make a decent living. Buy optimal amounts of food, spend the least amount of ammo, just the amount necessary for the job. By observing these simple rules you'll have much better chances not to end up like me. But I'm a dreamer, a dreamer that collects money just for the sake of it.

I came to the Zone with only one thing. I know you aren't supposed to take anything here if you want to bring it back, especially if it's alive and all, because of all the radiation. But it was the most precious thing I've ever had. It was a duckling. The cutest little yellow thing. Quacking like crazy all the time. I wanted to keep it inside so that it wouldn't attract attention. I had a plan on how to feed it and everything. It slept near my heart, where it was the warmest. I had it for 20 days, and when I came to the Zone, it didn't even survive a few hours. Normal animals don't last long here. Just those crows, and I'm not even sure they are normal at all. I've seen them scream like robots, and gouge out eyes of pseudogiants. They are vicious thieves too. If you have some trinkets, golden, silver, doesn't matter, they will take it if you stash them somewhere they can easily reach. Once this drunkard started shooting at the sky for no reason and he hit a crow by accident. How surprised he was when he saw that it was holding this golden watch in its beak. It reminded me of the duckling I had with me. I've seen my friends die dogs' deaths in the mud here, but thinking about that duckling just makes my heart break.

Nobody cares about us down here. It's as if we don't even exist. The first few days we were in the spotlight. Stalkers, the Zone. Afterwards, they started ignoring everything that's going on here.
